item.title: Avalanche Q&A with Wildlife Studios - Expanding into Web3 Gaming
item.description: Speaker(s): @avalancheavax, @EdC, @NFT_Silent, @0xJ010 Held on: 16-03-2022 Written on: 16-03-2022 URL: https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1OdKrBgeddqKX Background Wildlife Studios 10 years company based in Brazil 2 billion mobile downloads across apps Top 10 mobile developer Castle Crush

item.title: Avalanche QnA with Chikn - Farmland and the New Era of NFTs
item.description: Speaker(s): @avalancheavax, @chikn_nft, @EdC, @SaltLampDAO Held on: 11-03-2022 Written on: 14-03-2022 URL: https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1DXGyDVDywVKM Why Avalanche? Other layer 2s don’t have that community that Avalanche has(yet) Potential of ERC721 and being able to constantly interact with NFTs Chikn as an idea Chikn kickstarted after seeing some generative art Inspired by Rarity Manifested and Wolf Game tried to improve on their tokenomics and engineer better supply and demand tried to let it grow organically, as a result community is more invested in vision Farmland Farmland touted to be first gamified LP farm Other tokens LP will be added in the future, probably 3rd party NFT tokens Airdrops are likely but still a secret.

item.title: Avalanche Summit 2022
item.description: Day 1 Derivatives - The Big Picture How Should Founders Look at VCs Defi Mass Market Adoption Gaming Reveal - Crabada

item.title: Defi Mass Market Adoption
item.description: Speaker(s): John Nahas, Harold Bosse ( Mastercard) Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Where are we in the Defi landscape 400T marketcap out there.

item.title: Derivatives - The Big Picture
item.description: Speaker(s): Christine Lee, Anand Gomes (not present), Darius Sit, Joshua Lim Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Ribbon Finance

item.title: Game-Changing Trends
item.description: Speaker(s): Marc Zeller, Grace Kwan, Eric Chen, Omer Demirel, Andrew Durgee Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Every Layer 1 are probably going to have a form of Layer 2 framework

item.title: Gaming Reveal - Ascenders
item.description: Speaker(s): Jackson Poon Held on: [[21-03-2022]] Written on: [[21-03-2022]] Background Ascenders on Avalanche inspired by zelda botw2, lego Classes Fighter - combat forward, for hardcore players Explorer - map discovery and explore overworld, for casual players Builder - collect nfts Team - Jackson Poon (CEO), Will Davis, Chris Rothwell Economy No ponzinomics lol Blacksmith has to craft items.

item.title: Gaming Reveal - Crabada
item.description: Speaker(s): KH Chan Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 Background Crabada Idle Game NFTs gets you $CRA and $TUS 5000 daily active users 20mil + daily volume 20% of Avalanche C-chain transactions Battle Game [[Crabada Battle Game]] Mid to end april real time PvP and PvE (feels like Axie Infinity) Crafting based economy Crabs improve and maximize using a in-game currency (shells).

item.title: Gaming Reveal - Wildlife Studios
item.description: Speaker(s): Fernando Sette Held on: [[21-03-2022]] Written on: [[21-03-2022]] Background Vision - attract and develop the most amazing game designers Plan to invest >200mil to make Wildlife Studios the go-to place for best game designers Blockchain allows for different social dynamics between players and dev Assets in one game has value in another game.

item.title: How Should Founders Look at VCs
item.description: Speaker(s): Joon Ian Wong, Travis Scher, Amos Meiri, Peter Najarian , Jeffrey Amico Held on: 21-03-2022 Written on: 21-03-2022 On Venture capitalists and founders Venture Capitalist in web2 and web3 not that different give guidance, capital which founders needs when tech has matured, then it might be different naive to believe that web3 companies can mature without expertise of VCs founders do want the help Difference: hyper competitive Founders need to decide if they want the capital or the help Having a warchest and help (half rugged) communication takes place much openly on twitter uhh they rugged the livestream
